cold_snaps.status: There is no cold snap at the moment.  This year has experienced 6 cold snaps, with an average of 3.7 per year.

extreme.status: The largest temperature difference recorded was 26.7°C on 29 April 2025.  On that date the temperature reached 27.1°C and fell to 0.4°C.

heatwave.status: At present, there is no heatwave.  This year has seen 6 heatwaves; typically, 1.9 heatwaves occur annually.

heaviest_rainfall.status: Today's storm ranked 8th for total rainfall with 13.04mm having fallen, indicating an exceptionally wet day.  8.6mm per hour fell at points during the storm which lasted 7.9 hours.  The largest amount of rain ever recorded was on 04 January 2025 when 27.64mm fell at a maximum rate of 4.6mm per hour over the 15.9 hour event.

heaviest_rainrate.status: 27.0mm per hour was the peak rain rate recorded on 03 September 2025 ranking top from our records.  This was sustained over 2.0 hours and 27.0mm per hour was faliing at times.

storm.status: The lengthiest precipitation event recorded spanned 23.2 hours on 23 November 2024, characterized by a peak rain intensity of 6.4mm per hour and a total rainfall of 24.56mm.
A storm is currently nearby.  It's the first significant stormy weather event since September 03, 2025.

top_10_rainy.status: This period, starting August 26, 2025, is ranked 4th among the longest rainy periods since August 2024.  It has lasted 9 days consecutively so far.

tropical: The most recent tropical night was on July 18, 2025 and this has only occurred 62 times since 1973.

average.status: The current wind direction is south-westerly (208°), which is about average.  In the UK, a south-westerly wind often means mild and wet weather.

gusts.status: The record wind gust remains at 93.7 mph from 13 Oct 2012.

run.status: To date, the maximum wind run recorded was 1754 miles on 21 Oct 2012.  The long-term average wind run is 229.42 miles and so far today the wind run is 77.58 miles.

speed.status: The largest wind speed ever was on 13 Oct 2012 with a value of 93.7 mph.

summary.description:
Today, a bit warmer for the feels like temperature (up 3.8°C) and outside temperature (up 2.9°C) and more moisture-laden rainfall (up 2.6 mm).

The past week and month had observable variation in cloud levels (up 1700 m) and inside temperature (up 2.2°C) when compared to today.

cloud levels.description:
Today’s average cloud levels is 113.0m lower than yesterday, 596.5m lower than the past week, 1699.5m lower than the past month.

Yesterday, the cloud levels ranged from a minimum of 713m to a maximum of 1594m, averaging 953.9m; the past week and month had slightly higher averages of 1550.4m and 2650m respectively.

summary.summary: Inside; comfortable and pleasant temperatures. Outside; like a nice, warm day. Also, oppressively muggy and sticky and calm and still conditions are expected. Rain showers likely, occasional overcast conditions, and moderate levels of sunlight will be present. Low pressure may bring unsettled weather.
